definition: fully armed/armed to the teeth/fig. fully equipped
secondary/auxiliary/deputy/assistant/vice-/abbr. for 副詞|副词 adverb/classifier for pairs, sets of things & facial expressions
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: John turned up for the ten-mile walk equipped for something more like an assault on Everest.
sentences.chinese: 约翰转而开始了十英里的行军，全副武装。

sentences.english: Is that why I appear to be in downtown Fallujah behind the wheel of an up-armored Humvee?
sentences.chinese: 所以我在费卢杰市区，跟在一辆全副武装的悍马后面？

sentences.english: Heavily armed and armored weapon platform.
sentences.chinese: 全副武装的和披甲的武器平台。

sentences.english: I drew him in his SS regalia.
sentences.chinese: 我把他画成党卫队全副武装的样子。

sentences.english: The Stegosaurus was a well-equipped fighter.
sentences.chinese: 剑龙是个一个全副武装的战士。

sentences.english: Part of the crackdown patrols by heavily-armed soldiers and police.
sentences.chinese: 部分治安巡逻任务由全副武装的军警担任。

sentences.english: They were met by black-clad police with helmets, face masks and small round riot shields.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察，全副武装，青衣面甲，手执圆盾。
全副武装地为你的候选人辩护。

sentences.english: He was always armed and he always seemed ready to fight.
sentences.chinese: 他总是全副武装，好像随时准备要战斗的样子。

sentences.english: The robbers were armed to the teeth when they robbed the bank.
sentences.chinese: 劫匪们抢银行的时候是全副武装的。

sentences.english: You just need to weaponize your day.
sentences.chinese: 你需要做的仅仅是“全副武装”今天。

sentences.english: Ching Ming 2010 fully armed to go before the father nectar.
sentences.chinese: 到2010年清明前爸爸全副武装去采蜜。

sentences.english: He was always armed, and he always seemed ready to fight.
sentences.chinese: 他总是全副武装，好像随时准备要战斗的样子。

sentences.english: I came across this heavily armed Iraqi border guard.
sentences.chinese: 我碰到这个全副武装的伊拉克边防军士兵。

sentences.english: Rain, a group of heavily armed soldiers to 18 divisions command stealth.
sentences.chinese: 雨幕中，一队全副武装的士兵向十八师团司令部潜行。

sentences.english: I pointed to Ahaziah and shouted to my friends, wholooked like soldiers in their armour and their swords.
sentences.chinese: 我指着亚哈谢向我那些全副武装的战友们说。

definition: to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
to put on a suit of armor/to put on dress/to wear
